text: Better Homes and Gardens is the fourth most widely circulated magazine in the United States. It focuses on interests regarding homes, cooking, gardening, crafts, healthy living, decorating, and entertaining. It is published 12 times per year by Dotdash Meredith. It was founded in 1922 by Edwin Meredith, who had served as the United States Secretary of Agriculture under Woodrow Wilson and had previously founded the magazine Successful Farming. Category:American women's magazines Category:Monthly magazines
title: Better Homes and Gardens (magazine)
